_comment1: Information linking process control FCS files to the appropriate cytometer channels, to be supplied by TA3

tasbe_process_control_data._comment1: the rdf:about field is a URI that persistently identifies this process control information set
tasbe_process_control_data._comment2: Compatible TASBE interface version, following Semantic Versioning (semver.org).  Note that underspecifying version allows use of backward compatible upgrades.
tasbe_process_control_data._comment3: identifier linking to the instrument and optical configuration used for collecting data
tasbe_process_control_data._comment4: all files are URIs to the location of a file on the TA4 infrastructure
tasbe_process_control_data._comment5: name of the type of beads being used; must match an entry in the TASBE bead catalog https://github.com/TASBE/TASBEFlowAnalytics/blob/master/code/BeadCatalog.xlsx
tasbe_process_control_data._comment6: name of the batch of beads being used; must match an entry in the TASBE bead catalog https://github.com/TASBE/TASBEFlowAnalytics/blob/master/code/BeadCatalog.xlsx
tasbe_process_control_data._comment7: the blank file should be wild-type or null transfection
tasbe_process_control_data._comment8: each channel should have a strong single positive control of the species it quantifies

channels._comment1: name must match a channel from the cytometer configuration
channels.name: FITC-A
channels._comment2: FCS file for single positive control

tasbe_process_control_data._comment9: cross-file pairs are for converting to FITC units; only needed if a fluorescent protein is measured outside the FITC channel

cross_file_pairs._comment1: array of two or three channels: the first two will be compared. If the third is available, it will be used to improve clustering of the first two.
